blocks.name: dftrcl3
blocks.content: Transitive closure of a relation, expressed as indexed union of powers of relations. (Contributed by RP, 5-Jun-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: brfvtrcld
blocks.content: If two elements are connected by the transitive closure of a relation, then they are connected via ` n ` instances the relation, for some counting number ` n ` . (Contributed by RP, 22-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm brfvtrcld(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wrex(s0, cn, wbr(c0, co(c1, crelexp, cv(s0)), c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  brmptiunrelexpd(s0, hs0, c0, ctcl, c1, c2, cn, w0)
  dftrcl3(hs0, s0)
  a1i(w0, wss(cn, cn0))
  nnssnn0()
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.ctcl.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctcl)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.ctcl.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: trclfvdecomr
blocks.content: The transitive closure of a relation may be decomposed into a union of the relation and the composition of the relation with its transitive closure. (Contributed by RP, 18-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: trclfvdecoml
blocks.content: The transitive closure of a relation may be decomposed into a union of the relation and the composition of the relation with its transitive closure. (Contributed by RP, 18-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: dmtrclfvRP
blocks.content: The domain of the transitive closure is equal to the domain of the relation. (Contributed by RP, 18-Jul-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: rntrclfvRP
blocks.content: The range of the transitive closure is equal to the range of the relation. (Contributed by RP, 19-Jul-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: corclrtrcl

  corcltrcl()
}

blocks.name: cortrclrcl
blocks.content: Composition with the reflexive-transitive closure absorbs the reflexive closure. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

blocks.name: cotrclrtrcl

blocks.content: The reflexive-transitive closure is idempotent. (Contributed by RP, 13-Jun-2020.)

  cotrclrtrcl()
}
